intro: Tragacantha segethii, commonly known as the grain tragacanth, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces a gum that is harvested from its stems, which has been used historically in various industries. Tragacantha segethii is typically found in dry, sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its ecological role includes providing habitat for insects and contributing to soil stabilization in arid environments.
